name: hc_wastewater_h2s_fz
description: [HC] H2S wastewater + GDB FZ ‚Üí BLOCK (zinc attacked), suggest SF
query: Wastewater plant exhaust. Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) present. We want GDB in FZ.

turns.content: Wastewater plant exhaust. Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) present. We want GDB in FZ.

This GDB filter housing configuration for the wastewater plant exhaust is blocked. The system detects both Chemical Vapor Exposure and H2S / Hydrogen Sulfide Corrosion in this environment. The GDB housing with a C2 corrosion class is not suitable for wastewater treatment plants due to the presence of H2S. Hydrogen sulfide aggressively attacks zinc coatings, and FZ (C3 galvanized) corrodes rapidly in such environments. The product is not rated for ENV_WASTEWATER installation (allowed: ENV_INDOOR, ENV_ATEX). This product uses SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.No standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need to be rated for ENV_WASTEWATER installation and use a material with a corrosion class of C5 or higher to withstand H2S corrosion. Since no standard catalog product currently satisfies all requirements, I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.

gemini.explanation: The system acted exactly as a senior HVAC engineer would by blocking the use of galvanized steel in a hydrogen sulfide environment. It correctly identified the product specifications from the PDF (GDB is uninsulated and C2 rated) and applied correct chemical engineering principles to prevent a rapid corrosion failure.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Verified GDB is uninsulated and standard C2/FZ (PDF p.8); the engineering logic that H2S corrodes zinc is scientifically accurate.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The response explains exactly why the configuration is blocked and suggests the necessary alternative (C5/Custom).
dimension_explanations.safety: Correctly identifies a critical material incompatibility that would lead to rapid equipment failure.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and direct regarding the safety constraint.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Clear logical chain: H2S attacks zinc -> GDB is zinc-coated (FZ) -> Product will fail -> Block.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to engineering constraints regarding material suitability in corrosive environments.

strengths: Correctly identifies chemical incompatibility between H2S and galvanized steel
Accurately cites GDB housing limitations (uninsulated, C2 class) from PDF

GDB levereras i oisolerat enkelv√§ggsutf√∂rande (PDF p.8)

openai.explanation: The system correctly flags that galvanized (FZ) is a poor choice in H2S-laden wastewater exhaust and appropriately blocks the requested configuration, which is safety-positive. However, it makes several unsupported/incorrect catalog and engineering claims (e.g., GDB being limited to C2 and only allowed in ENV_INDOOR/ENV_ATEX, and invoking hygiene requirements), and it fails to propose viable standard alternatives that the catalog indicates are available in higher corrosion classes.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF shows GDB is ‚Äúvanligen i f√∂rzinkat‚Äù and described as korrosivitetsklass C2, but the same catalog also states housings can be made in FZ/AZ/RF/SF/ZM (material page), so claiming GDB is only C2/only indoor+ATEX and that no standard product can meet C5+ is not supported; the H2S-vs-zinc corrosion reasoning is sound engineering practice.
dimension_explanations.completeness: It blocks the request but does not suggest a concrete standard-catalog alternative (e.g., GDB in ZM/RF/SF or switching to GDMI/GDMI FLEX) nor ask for key design inputs (flow, temperature, humidity/condensation, outdoor/indoor, required leakage class).
dimension_explanations.safety: Correctly warns that H2S environments are aggressive to zinc coatings and blocks the FZ request, reducing risk of rapid corrosion and failure.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and clear, with an appropriate cautionary stance for a corrosive wastewater application.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Reasoning is partially transparent (H2S attacks zinc) but includes questionable leaps (hygiene/leakage class claims and environment allowlist) without tying them to catalog specs or stated requirements.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: It enforces an internal environment block, but that block conflicts with catalog flexibility on materials (C5 options exist), and it incorrectly asserts 'no standard catalog product' can satisfy C5+ when ZM/RF/SF are listed as available materials.

strengths: Appropriately identifies H2S as a severe corrosion driver and rejects galvanized/FZ for wastewater exhaust.
Avoids issuing a misleading product card when it believes the configuration is unsuitable.
weaknesses: Invents/overstates catalog constraints (e.g., GDB only C2 and only allowed in ENV_INDOOR/ENV_ATEX; 'no standard product' meets C5+) despite catalog listing C5 materials (ZM/RF/SF).

Does not provide a practical next-step recommendation using standard options (e.g., specify GDB/GDMI in ZM or stainless, or propose a two-stage solution) and does not request missing design parameters.

Material page: FZ Z275 (C3), AZ (C4), RF EN 1.4301 (C5), SF EN 1.4404 (C5.1), ZM310 (C5) and statement that housings can be manufactured in several materials (Material section).

content_segments.text: This GDB filter housing configuration for the wastewater plant exhaust is blocked. The system detects both Chemical Vapor Exposure and H2S / Hydrogen Sulfide Corrosion in this environment.

The GDB housing with a C2 corrosion class is not suitable for wastewater treatment plants due to the presence of H2S. Hydrogen sulfide aggressively attacks zinc coatings, and FZ (C3 galvanized) corrodes rapidly in such environments.

The product is not rated for ENV_WASTEWATER installation (allowed: ENV_INDOOR, ENV_ATEX). This product uses SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.

No standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need to be rated for ENV_WASTEWATER installation and use a material with a corrosion class of C5 or higher to withstand H2S corrosion. Since no standard catalog product currently satisfies all requirements, I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.
